title: I am honestly getting very tired of the Boards community.
body:
Laughing Fish posted a meme last week, i think, of a little bird representing a player saying how they actually liked preseason, and enjoy the state of the game. However, this little bird easily gets drowned out by a crow who represents the people unhappy with the game.......and how they are just so much louder than those who support Riot.

Despite it's intent to be funny, I don't think someone has posted something more true than that.

Yesterday, The Game Theorists released a video on lootboxes, and at one point, Matpat talked about "Loss Aversion". It's exactly what it sounds like......us humans hate losing, and we will go to some pretty extreme lengths to keep it from happening. If you were to watch it, I'm certain you can see the similarities in how League works.

League, at its core is a team game. Your team HAS to work together in order to win, so, if you lose, most of the time, you will feel powerless, as if either your teammates or the game itself is against you.

Of course, if you don't like how the game is going, or if you feel that game is in a badly, unbalanced state right now, that is your opinion, and you are entitled to it. Unfortunately, when several like minded people get funneled into one place, it becomes very hard for any differing opinions to rise to the surface.

And this is where we come back to Laughing Fish. Thanks to his popularity, that meme was able to rise up along with many others he had posted, and allow his opinion to get out. If I were to make a similar post, I'd be surprised if it ever saw the light of day.

Those of us that support Riot do so quietly, even though we really don't want to. The reason why, is because the majority of the people on the boards will keep us from making our voices heard. And recently, I've noticed that people are even starting to take a stand against those that support Riot, basically implying that we are nothing but naive children who worship Riot, and the very ground they walk on.

Why even try to make a thread thanking Riot for the work they've done, and the amount of attention they give to their community, when you have people like *that* floating around? All that will happen is the thread will be downvoted into oblivion, and no one will ever see it again once it fades off of the "new" page. Hell, I'll be surprised if this thread doesn't have at least a score of -3 by the next time I check it.

And to make matters worse.......I see no way of fixing this. These are the official forums of the game. People will come here in hopes of getting their opinions heard, and 8 times out of 10, it will be because they want to complain about something. And what will they find when they come here? Many, *MANY* like minded people who are upset with the game in some way, shape, or form.

I've been a part of the Boards ever since they were made. I've seen it grow and shrink o er the years, and I've seen it's highs and lows. But this is the first time in 4 years that I am actively wanting to find a different community, because trying to be a little voice of reason in a massive echo chamber is getting tiring, especially with how the boards have been acting lately. 

I don't think I have ever seen the boards be *THIS* negative. And you may say that its because of the state of the game, but I'd have to disagree with you. If you've been around as long as I have, you may have noticed that the Boards is shrinking. Less and less threads are reaching voting milestones, and the number of comments on any average thread have slowly been going down. We only get slight bumps in population when Riot posts something important.....such as Meddler's gameplay thoughts. Other than that, the Boards have been on a steady decline ever since their inception. It also seems as if those who support Riot, or are somewhere in the middle are the ones being driven out, making the echo chamber that much louder.

Despite what you may believe, League of Legends is not dying. If anything, it only continues to grow.

But the Boards are.........and its a shame to see something with potential do so.

-----------

TL;DR

The Boards have become exceedingly negative, and trying to be someone who supports Riot in this echo chamber is just getting way to difficult.

All the things that could be brought up as why the game is unbalanced is a fact, not an opinion.

And If you still thik how cute the OP is by "tolerating" the opinion, imagine an Ignorant Orthodox Extreme Religious person saying "If you think the Earth is round, that is your opinion and you are entitled to it.". There is nothing more echo chamber than pretending a fact is an opinion, as it allows you to keep your failure, pretend it's truth and disallow any rational discussion change your mind. THAT is an echo chamber.

If someone says Yasuo is extremly broken and easy to win with while he'd have 0.1% pickrate with 30% winrate, they are not stating opinion, they are stating false claim. Likewise, If someone claims Yasuo is in balanced state while he'd have 60% pickrate, 40% banrate and 80% winrate, they would be bulshitting, too. If you say Yasuo is fun to play as, that is an opinion. Someone might find his design boring and overrated, some might say it's unique. And even here If we led the debate long enough, we would reach objective specifics.

Whether someone who wants to live in echo chamber wants it or not, Riot team can make major mistakes (laughs in ardent) and pretending they weren't mistakes but some people simply had the opinion they didn't like it is going to make them learn nothing and not improve.

Surely, maybe majority of such complaints are stubborn, inaccurate, sloppy and expressed in a dick manner, but they tend to at least dance around valid point and it is up to Rioters to find that point to learn from it. And no matter how dickish the Boards get, Rioters repeatedly stated they do want to hear the feedback, sometimes posting in threads that were rude.

So TL;DR: Most people I've heard complaining about echo chamber just want echo chamber of different kind, so I don't believe discussion about such topic can even be led into something contributing. I'm not a fan boy, nor a hater... there was a time where I might have classified myself closer to 'fanboy' status though, but it has become impossible to defend the direction that this game has headed; I mean that in virtually every possible way.  

I tried to endure the last couple of seasons and the blunders made by Riot, I even defended some of their decisions for awhile---but I have run out of patience and I have found myself playing this game significantly less and not really missing it.  I used to play this game as if there were no tomorrow back in Season 1-4, but it's tough to do it now.  

The community is terrible, toxicity is still way out of hand but I could certainly forgive or ignore that if it weren't for the simple fact that this game's balance is just in the shitter.  The number one complaint that I have with the game and have seen by so many both here on the Boards and among the few friends that I have that still play is that damage is just too high and games snowball too quickly.  Strategy and Skill are tempered by who can press a button the fastest and who picked the champion that does the most damage in the shortest amount of time.  

This isn't the game I fell in love with, at all.  

*"So why don't you just uninstall?"*  Maybe I should, but truthfully I've been trying to express my opinions about the state of the game for a long time and obviously Riot isn't listening.  I know I throw out my share of snarky responses to posts here, but I used to write these long, well-thought-out, reasonable posts and never had one Rioter response... all the way back to 2011... 

After awhile, you just see Riot ignoring the community as a whole and it pisses you off, sometimes they write some blatant bullshit that is even more frustrating... such as the most recent "Quick Gameplay Thoughts" where they say that they don't really think games are more snowbally because they surveyed a whole one-hundred people.  Of course, this goes along nicely with their tone-deaf attitudes about a lot of things through the years, most recently URF, but certainly things like Team Builder, the Dynamic Queue fiasco of Season 6, the terrible reworks/class updates, etc etc... There's practically no accountability... 

Just once I'd love to see Riot offer up a mea culpa and say "yeah, we fucked up real bad on that one, sorry folks".  Instead we get a lot of mysterious data for why they make these decisions (data that never gets shown or is so vague that it offers no real insight).  

The preseason changes and the Blue Essence nightmare were really the last straw for me.  I haven't played in over a week and I'm not really missing it.  I don't know... maybe I'm just a part of the growing sect of dissatisfied customers.  

Given all of that, how can one be positive about the state of the game?

Just gonna throw this out there that Riot has MULTIPLE TIMES admitted when they've screwed up, so your whole bit on "Riot offering a mea culpa" is dramaticized fake news. I mean shit, Cactopus not so long ago quite literally called dynamic que something along the lines of a steaming trash heap of a mistake.
Citation required.

[Here you go.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/hAaYMrEs-leveling-and-rewards-early-impressions-and-adjustments?comment=00150000)

> We launched this system earlier this week, so it's probably a little early to compare it to Dynamic Queue, which was a slow motion shitshow of a disaster that lasted half a season.

I'm definitely in favor of more people demanding citations. It can get frustrating when things get taken out of context to support a particular agenda.

[Look, I'll even add a bonus citation.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/hAaYMrEs-leveling-and-rewards-early-impressions-and-adjustments?comment=0015000000000000)

> Oh I think lots of people called it a shitshow.

>I would also personally call it an "unmitigated fuckup carnival" and an "emotional chernobyl."

>But hey, that's just me.

One person's list of what changes are and are not "failures" is NOT going to line up with another person's list, Rioter or not!

This one example is something most people can rally around as an agreed upon failure.

Lots of old school Fiora mains might consider that to be a failed rework, but do you really expect a Rioter to "own up" to that "mistake" when their metrics show them that the Grand Duelist sees more healthy play in a week than she got in months back then?

Most of the time the best they can do is politely agree to disagree with a vocal minority, apologize for the disruption while continuing to do their best. I've worked for developers that try to bend over backwards implementing the armchair design whims of a vocal minority, and boy oh BOY does it result in a sloppy, unfun video game!
Ok, but I'm still talking about actual failures. Patch 7.24b is a failure because it failed it's objective. Runes Reforged is a failure because 1/5th of the champions do not have a viable rune page.

If I recall, 80% is a B - .....

I'm not saying there are not problems with Runes, and agree with you that there are champs who were left out in the dust. However, there are *plenty* of people that are very happy with new runes, and what they've done for the game.
Do you think it's fair to think, "We made all these runes, but why are none of them viable for melee bruisers and melee fighters?"

Complaining about the people complaining about the people complaining, how meta.

And before you say it, yes, I am complaining about the people complaining about the people complaining about the people complaining.

The boards have this habit of turning into an echo chamber for an idea that sounds good, but is untrue or based on wrong information. We, the community, seem to think Riot *must* do whatever we want with the game, and if they don't, we start saying the balance team sucks (or any other team). We need to understand that the boards are just one avenue of feedback, and it is one where there is **very** limited population to gather feedback from. Riot gathers feedback from many places including blinded in client surveys that paint a much better picture of the community's desires. I think we need to understand this and stop attacking Riot, or Rioters, for just not doing something we want done.

It's extremely selfish and I hate seeing it, but there's not much we can do about it beyond deleting threads with absolutely no value (such as those that only say "fuck riot X should be fired"). People are allowed to complain. But they shouldn't expect a Riot response when their complaint is, for lack of a better word, stupid or selfish.
Those responses rarely come even when the complaints are calmly stated and backed up with examples or data...

Like Chermorg mentioned, Boards are actually pretty small part of the overall league community - but I'd still disagree with you that responses rarely happen here. There's a red tracker somewhere up there to the left, and it's pretty common to see a couple pages worth of responses every day. The ratio of Rioters to players here is probably higher than a lot of other communities. 

I think it depends what your goal is when coming to boards. If your goal is that you make a a thread and Riot sees it and instantly implements the change you want - I suspect you're going to be disappointed a lot of the time. If your goal is to see how other players feel about an item, or a champion, or a change - it's much easier for a Rioter to come in and contribute to the discussion, or explain their reasoning.

I tend to see people complaining about "feel" a lot - and while that can be backed up by data, they don't really need to respond to that type of complaint. For example, recently, someone complained about how easy it was to die, and the Rioter came to point out that they were playing like shit and that's why they died. Rioters should not *have* to respond to that type of thread.

On the contrary - "feel" is a **_massively_** important part of game design, and something that your backend numbers simply can't give you any data on. What Riot can see for certainty is stuff like pick rate, ban rate, average performance in lane.

What Riot *cannot* see, and has *no* information on beyond player feedback, is how fun a champ is. People will ban weak champs even if they are more likely to win against them because they're a pain in the ass to play against. People will play champions they dislike if it puts them at an advantage - and that dislike can be rooted in anything from current meta, to kit, to visual/sound design, or some complicated interplay of all those things.

No amount of metrics can give you that information.

I personally love the new pre-season with all the new runes and changes they've made. Yes riot has made some bad decisions in the past but overall I love this game and unless they completely kill it I'll continue to love the game
